member.name: T:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop
member.summary: RenderLoop provides a rendering loop infrastructure. See remarks for usage.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.Control
member.summary: Gets or sets the control to associate with the current render loop.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.UseApplicationDoEvents
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the render loop should use the default instead of a custom window message loop lightweight for GC. Default is false.
member.value: true if the render loop should use the default instead of a custom window message loop (default false); otherwise, false.
member.remarks: By default, RenderLoop is using a custom window message loop that is more lightweight than to process windows event message. Set this parameter to true to use the default .

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.NextFrame
member.summary: Calls this method on each frame.
member.returns: true if if the control is still active, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: T:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.RenderCallback
member.summary: Delegate for the rendering loop.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.Run(System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationContext,Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.RenderCallback)
member.summary: Runs the specified main loop in the specified context.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.Run(System.Windows.Forms.Control,Stride.Games.WindowsMessageLoop.RenderCallback,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the specified main loop for the specified windows form.
member.param: if set to true indicating whether the render loop should use the default instead of a custom window message loop lightweight for GC. Default is false.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameBase.UpdateTime
member.summary: The total and delta time to be used for logic running in the update loop.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameBase.DrawTime
member.summary: The total and delta time to be used for logic running in the draw loop.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameBase.DrawInterpolationFactor
member.summary:
Is used when we draw without running an update beforehand, so when both and are set.
It returns a number between 0 and 1 which represents the current position our DrawTime is in relation to the previous and next step.
0.5 would mean that we are rendering at a time halfway between the previous and next fixed-step.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target elapsed time, this is the duration of each tick/update when is enabled.

member.summary: Access to the throttler used to set the minimum time allowed between each updates.

member.summary: Access to the throttler used to set the minimum time allowed between each updates while the window is minimized and, depending on , while unfocused.

member.summary: Considers windows without user focus like a minimized window for

member.summary: Should this instance still render/draw when the window is minimized. Updates are still going to run regardless of the value set.

member.summary: Resets the elapsed time counter.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.PrepareContext
member.summary: Creates or updates before window and device are created.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.SuppressDraw
member.summary: Prevents calls to Draw until the next Update.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.Tick
member.summary: Updates the game's clock and calls Update and Draw.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.RawTickProducer
member.summary: Calls automatically based on this game's setup, override it to implement your own system.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.RawTick(System.TimeSpan,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Call this method within your overriden to update and draw the game yourself.
As this version is manual, there are a lot of functionality purposefully skipped:
clamping elapsed time to a maximum, skipping drawing when the window is minimized, , , ,
, / / .
member.param: The amount of time passed between each update of the game's system, the total time passed would be * .
The amount of updates that will be executed on the game's systems.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.BeginRun
member.summary: Called after all components are initialized, before the game loop starts.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.EndRun
member.summary: Called after the game loop has stopped running before exiting.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.BeginDraw
member.summary: Starts the drawing of a frame. This method is followed by calls to , and .
member.returns: true to continue drawing, false to not call and

member.summary: Reference page contains code sample.
member.param: Time passed since the last call to Draw.

member.name: M:Stride.Games.GameBase.EndDraw(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ends the drawing of a frame. This method will always be preceeded by calls to and perhaps depending on if we had to do so.

member.name: T:Stride.Games.GameContext`1
member.summary: Generic version of . The later is used to describe a generic game Context. This version enables us to constraint the game context to a specifc toolkit and ensures a better cohesion between the various toolkit specific classes, such as InputManager, GameWindow.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameTime.WarpElapsed
member.summary: Gets the amount of time elapsed multiplied by the time factor.

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameTime.Factor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the time factor.
This value controls how much the warped time flows, this includes physics, animations and particles. A value between 0 and 1 will slow time, a value above 1 will make it faster.
member.value: The multiply factor, a double value higher or equal to 0

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameWindow.PreferredWindowedSize

member.summary: The size the window should have when switching from windowed to fullscreen mode. To get the current actual size use .

member.name: P:Stride.Games.GameWindow.FullscreenIsBorderlessWindow
member.summary: Whether the fullscreen mode should be a borderless window matching the desktop size.

member.summary: Only used internally by the device managers when they adapt the window size to the backbuffer size. Resizes the window, without sending the resized event.

member.name: T:Stride.StrideVersion
member.summary: Internal version used to identify Stride version.
member.remarks: During package build, PackageUpdateVersionTask is updating that file and expect some specific text regex so be careful if you change any of this.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.PublicVersion
member.summary: The version used by editor for display purpose. 4th digit needs to be at least 1 if used (due to NuGet special cases).

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyVersion
member.summary: The current assembly version as text, currently same as .

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSimple
member.summary: The NuGet package version without special tags.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersion
member.summary: The NuGet package version.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.NuGetVersionSuffix
member.summary: The NuGet package suffix (i.e. -beta01). Automatically set by Stride.GitVersioning.GenerateVersionFile. Three possible values: - Empty: official release - -betaXX: development version (XX should corespond to development asset versioning) - -betaXX-YYYY: beta release (YYYY is the git height since current version has been bumped)

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.BuildMetadata
member.summary: The build metadata, usually +g[git_hash] during package. Automatically set by Stride.GitVersioning.GenerateVersionFile.

member.name: F:Stride.StrideVersion.AssemblyInformationalVersion
member.summary: The informational assembly version, containing -beta01 or +g[git_hash] during package.

member.name: T:Stride.PublicKeys
member.summary: Assembly signing information.

member.name: F:Stride.PublicKeys.Default
member.summary: Assembly name suffix that contains signing information.
